topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5529df8b63687262e9ab0200#post_5529df8b63687262e9ab0200
What game?


I'm currently rewatching all of ghost in the shell franchise and I have to say it deserves the notion of being a deep philosophical franchise.  I'm not talking about pseudo philosophical franchises where the topics are never discussed by the main characters, but rather I'm watching Innocence right now and their discussion on how humans desire to mechanize themselves to escape nature's limitations on their bodies and by proxy death is fairly relevant in that the gynoids are ghost dubbed in order to make them more human by doing so you're essentially creating a living puppet; not biologically alive but still alive nonetheless because puppets are hyperidealized representations of humans.
